turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Lithium bis(trimethylsilyl)amide.
turn.1: What is the synthesis of Lithium bis(trimethylsilyl)amide?
turn.2: Lithium bis(trimethylsilyl)amide  Lithium bis(trimethylsilyl)amide is a lithiated organosilicon compound with the formula LiN(SiMe).
turn.3: What are the uses of the compound?
turn.4: It is commonly abbreviated as LiHMDS (lithium hexamethyldisilazide - a reference to its conjugate acid HMDS) and is primarily used as a strong non-nucleophilic base and as a ligand.
turn.5: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.6: Like many lithium reagents, it has a tendency to aggregate and will form a cyclic trimer in the absence of coordinating species.
turn.7: Where can the compound be found?
turn.8: LiHMDS is commercially available, but it can also be prepared by the deprotonation of bis(trimethylsilyl)amine with n-butyllithium.
turn.9: In what form is the compound found?
turn.10: This reaction can be performed "in situ".
turn.11: Is the compound a solid or a liquid?
turn.12: Once formed, the compound can be purified by sublimation or distillation.
